Potential awards and incentives you can receive from taking your IPPT

string-array.name: information_details
string-array.item: IPPT is a mandatory annual (within a 12-month period, i.e. your IPPT window) requirement for all eligible NSmen with PES A, B/ B1/ B2/ C1 status. Your first IPPT window starts on your birthday after your Operationally Ready Date (ORD) and ends a day before your next birthday.

You need to take and pass your annual IPPT within your IPPT window. The IPPT comprises 3 stations â€“ Push-Ups, Sit-Ups and 2.4km Run. To pass, you need to score a minimum of 1 point in each station, and achieve a total score of at least 51 out of 100 points. The IPPT scoring system is calibrated to your age, and you will receive different incentive awards depending on the total score.

If you fail your IPPT, you may retake it multiple times within your IPPT window. Once your current IPPT window has closed and you still have not passed your IPPT, you will need to complete 10 sessions of mandatory NS Fitness Improvement Training (FIT) in your next IPPT window. If you are not exempted and did not take your annual IPPT within your IPPT window, you will be considered an IPPT defaulter. You will be called back for investigation and may be subjected to disciplinary action. In addition, you are required to complete 10 mandatory NS FIT sessions in your next window.
You can be exempted from your annual fitness requirements once you have been disrupted from your Operationally Ready National Service (ORNS) duties.
To measure the major components of physical fitness, your IPPT will consist of 3 stations. Push-Ups, Sit-Ups and 2.4km Run.
You will earn points that are calibrated to your age group at each IPPT station. These age groups are adjusted within 3-year bands.
NSmen who achieve a gold award for their IPPT receive $500, $300 for a silver award, and $200 for a pass with incentive.

You can take your IPPT at any of the FCCs that best suits your schedule. Reporting time is 15 minutes before each IPPT session, i.e. 1645 hrs / 1845hrs for the weekday session and 0715 hrs / 1645 hrs / 1745 hrs for the Saturday session respectively.
